Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Dish
Description: Hemispherical dish of a very simple shape, ending in a rounded lip. Crudely manufactured. The clay is typical of utility wares of the Middle Kerma period: coarse, with a high percentage of organic temper, black, oxidised on the exterior (therefore beige-orange) and polished.
